column4: does anyone could give me a link to a page, there i can figure out:
- how long security fixes are available for each release
- how I can upgrade similar to debian to a newer release
probably on the support page, 18 months for each release, you upgrade just as yo uwould on Debian
ie, with apt/synaptic/aptitude, and only after reading the upgrade notes
if you're interested in further paid support, I'm sure someone at canonical would love to talk to you
you can email info@canonical.com if you want to talk to someone about support
yes but I must figure out how expensive a longer support is
do you know if it is possible to upgrade from one release to an other, easily?
should work at least as well as Debian does
most people try to avoid it
because people have long memories and it used to do terrible things to config files
hmm what is interessting. I had never an problem with webmin. could you tell me more?
it used to suck. I have no idea if it does or doesn't anymore, but using a web interface to edit config files is always going to be flakey.
